job_history.role_name: SVP, Regional Sales Director Wealth Management
job_history.work_description: Responsible of managing a team of 24 relationship managers for delivering personalized financial strategies to affluent clientele through banking and borrowing needs, as well as, investments services.

Managed Citizens Bank's Business Banking Contact Center in RI and PA, this was a Short term project to enhance the client experience and to create efficiencies in all Phonebank related sales activities.
Manage a team of 21 Business Banking Officers in Boston Downtown Region
Managed a sales staff of 15 and established a follow-up program for the sales team

skills.name: Leadership
skills.explanation: Has extensive experience in leadership roles, managing teams of up to 24 people, and leading various projects, indicating expert-level mastery.

skills.name: Sales Management
skills.explanation: Has over 20 years of experience in sales management, including managing sales staff and establishing follow-up programs, indicating expert-level mastery.

skills.name: Financial Services
skills.explanation: Has extensive experience in the financial services industry, including wealth management, banking, and investments, suggesting strong proficiency.

skills.name: Client Relationship Management
skills.explanation: Has experience in delivering personalized financial strategies to affluent clientele, suggesting strong proficiency in client relationship management.

skills.name: Team Management
skills.explanation: Has experience in managing teams of up to 24 people, suggesting strong proficiency in team management.

skills.name: Business Banking
skills.explanation: Has extensive experience in business banking, including managing business banking officers and leading business banking groups, suggesting strong proficiency.

skills.name: Executive Leadership
skills.explanation: Has completed executive education in leadership management and has experience in leading various projects, suggesting strong proficiency in executive leadership.
